pageContext.claim: “And we ended up, I started speaking at 1:00 in the morning [in 2016]. Now it was election day, and we had 32,000 people. Is that right? We had 32,000 people and I looked and I said, it was 1:00 in the morning, and you know, Barack Hussein Obama, and Hillary came, and Bill Clinton came, and they all came, the whole group...Now their visit was at 7:00 which is primetime. They had 500 people. I started speaking at 1:00 in the morning. We had 32,000. So it's now election day. ”
pageContext.analysis: This is a fantasy. The Michigan venue where Trump rallied in the early morning hours of Election Day 2016, DeVos Place in downtown Grand Rapids, has a capacity of 4,200, far less than the 32,000 claimed by Trump. (Perhaps that many were waiting outside, for a total of 8,000, local media estimated.) Hillary Clinton held a rally the same day at nearby Grand Valley State University; it was described as a “capacity crowd” at a venue that holds 4,100 people.
